column3: is a north-south motorway in Pakistan
column4: which connects Multan with Sukkur. This motorway is 392 km long and six lanes wide and was build as a part of China-Pakistan Economic Corridor.

column1: Approval for the Multan-Sukkur Motorway (M-5) was granted in July 2014. In May 2016
column2: the Pakistani government  awarded the contract to build this section to China State Construction Engineering
column3: with the completion date being August 2019.

column1: Former Prime Minister Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif inaugurated the motorway on 6 May 2016. Actual ground work started in August 2016. The M5 Motorway project forms a cornerstone of the much-larger China–Pakistan Economic Corridor.
The Sukkur - Multan Motorway (M-5) cost approximately $2.94 billion
column2: with the bulk of financing financed by various Chinese state-owned banks.

column1: 90% of the project's cost was financed through concessionary loans on interest rates of 1.6% from China
column2: while the remaining balance is financed by government of Pakistan.

column1: Starting from Multan the six lane motorway passes through Jalalpur Pirwala
column5: Ubauro and Pano Aqil before it terminates at Sukkur. The project consists of 54 bridges including one major bridge on the river Sutlej. The motorway has 12 service areas
column9: and 426 underpasses. The motorway was inaugurated on 5 November 2019.
